channel.title: The Rykerr Medical Podcast
channel.description: Rykerr Medical LLC is a platform for education focused on emergency, transport, and critical care medicine.
channel.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Dan Taylor Chats Non-Traditional Paramedic Work
item.description:
Dan Taylor is a remote and critical care paramedic who has spent most of his career providing medical care and education in remote and austere settings around the world. Specifically, he has extensive experience in hazardous and conflict environments. On this episode, Dan and Ryan discuss the intricacies of working in this space and how one might go about getting a foot in the door if interested.

Dan's website is frozenmedical.com and he has all sorts of resources on that page. You can also follow him on instagram, @frozenmedical

Notes on everything we discuss in the episode: https://www.rykerrmedical.com/not-linked/show-notes-dan-taylor-podcast/

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/dan-taylor-chats-non-traditional-paramedic-work

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Drew and Ryan Discuss EMS Education at SFCC and in NM
item.description:
Drew is the Director at the EMS Institute at Santa Fe Community College. He and Ryan discuss, among many other things, a critical care transport course they have recently rolled out, how EMSI and SFCC approach EMS education given unique challenges in New Mexico, the state of EMS training in New Mexico as a whole, and incorporating ultrasound training into initial paramedic training programs.

Learn more by following the EMSI on IG at @sfcc_ems_institute, by checking out their webpage at sfcc.edu/programs/paramedicine or by contacting Drew directly: drew.congdon@sfcc.edu

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/drew-and-ryan-discuss-ems-education-at-sfcc-and-in-nm

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: A Conversation with Flight Nurse Morgan Holmes
item.description:
Morgan is an ICU nurse turned flight nurse out in NM. Ryan asks him some questions about how it’s been getting into flight and what he’s up to with a new project built to help others navigate the transition. Morgan then asks Ryan about the work he’s been up to outside of the CCT world.

Morgan can be found on IG at @criticalcarecommunity

His project is at: https://www.skool.com/flight-nurse-mentoring-6195/about

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/a-conversation-with-flight-nurse-morgan-holmes

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project

item.title: Ventilation in Transport with Melody Bishop
item.description:
In this episode we discuss all things ventilator with Melody Bishop, RT.

Find her at @melodybishop_rt on Instagram!

and read her vent book here: https://ecampusontario.pressbooks.pub/mechanicalventilators/

item.title: Articulating Thoughts with the Ryans
item.description:
This is a recorded session of tutoring with SFCEBM. Ryan from Rykerr Medical chats with Ryan from Canada about how to explain concepts and thought processes as he works through a mentorship program.

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/articulating-thoughts-with-the-ryans_202502

item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Ukraine Chat with Sarah and Jason
item.description:
Sarah is a brand-new EMT currently working in Ukraine with an NGO called CADUS. Jason is a nurse/ medic who worked with her over there earlier this year through GRM, another NGO. This is a conversation the three of us had to both catch up on things and share the story with you.

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/ukraine-chat-with-sarah-and-jason_202502

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Sleep Discussion with MandoMedic
item.description:
In this episode we discuss strategies to improve and optimize sleep while working 24 and 48 hour shifts as we often do in EMS. Our guest is MandoMedic; he hails from the European Medics community and you can find him either on their Discord channel or on Instagram @TheMandoMedic.

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/sleep-discussion-with-mando-medic_202502

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Patient Assessment in EMS and CCT
item.description:
This episode is just one voice chatting about how we do patient assessment in EMS, how that differs from the way we do it in nursing, and then how we can come up with an ideal blend to put to work in the critical care transport setting.

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/patient-assessment-in-ems-and-cct

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: EMS in Haiti with Claudel and Armadeus
item.description:
The primary story here is getting Claudel to medic school in order to become Haiti’s first paramedic. He needs your support, so check it out and see what can be done. We also mention some other cool stuff along the way. www.empacthaiti.org. And as always, let us know what you think!

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/ems-in-haiti-with-claudel-and-armadeus_202502

www.rykerrmedical.com to see what else is going on with the project
item.itunes:author: Rykerr Medical

item.title: Scripts Discussion with Richard
item.description:
In this episode we discuss the idea of creating scripts for learning protocols and refining procedures with Richard Templeman, a flight paramedic in Nevada. We talk about the development of the idea, outline how we've used it personally, and provide examples of how you can do the same in your own clinical practice. Let us know what you think and reach out with any questions.

episode webpage: https://archive.org/details/scripts-discussion-with-richard_202502

item.description:
